_header: At matin hours in the mids of the night
Subjects: old age, praise of; ages of man’s life
_description: Walter Kennedy, ‘The Praise of Aige’, — five 8-line stanzas, ababbcbc, including refrain, ‘Honour with aige to every vertew drawis’

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
At matine hour in middis of the nichtwaiknit of sleip I saw besyd
                    me sone…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…Ȝoutheid adew ane of my mortall faisHonour to age with
                    everie vertew drawis
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.234-5.

Banna.First Lines:
At matyne houre in midis of the nichtWalknit of sleip I saw besyd
                    me sone…
Banna.Last Lines:
…Ȝowtheid adew ane of my mortall faisHonor with aige with
                    every vertew drawis
